history.text: Home Alone is a seriously awesome movie.
I thought it was awesome too. I see the critics also enjoyed it.
I think they're somewhat split between enjoying it and thinking it's a bit too shallow
Rotten Tomatoes gave a very poor rating. I can't believe that.
I still think this is Joe Pesci's best role.

Yes it is. I really don't like him in anything else. 
I wonder if the Director's real name is actually Chris Columbus.
I suppose anything is possible. I can't believe it came out in 1990. It still sorta feels like it wasn't that long ago.
Right??!! Makes me feel old. Macaulay Culkin is looking pretty rough now, he was so cute in this movie.
I agree. I think he had it rough for awhile after, but from what I've read and seen, he's doing much better lately.
I don't see how any parents can forget their kids at home when they are going on vacation. That seems a little far fetched.
I agree, but I think it becomes slightly more believable when there's such a big group of them and you're freaking out about catching flights.
They overslept because the power went out and their alarm clocks reset. That would not have happened if they had cell phones.
Oh, nowadays it's almost impossible to get left behind like that.
Poor kid getting made fun of by his family and then they leave him.
To be fair, he was being a bit obnoxious as well.
What 8 year old isn't? The whole family flying to Paris. I wonder how much the tickets cost!
That was one of my biggest questions: what job did the dad have that he can afford to pay for TWO families to fly to Paris for Christmas? Not to mention how enormous their house is.
The mom rides home with the Polka band. I don't think that's safe. But I guess it was the 90s.
That's true! I forgot about that
Also, Chicago is like the most unsafe place for that poor kid to be alone.
It seriously is! Was it less dangerous in the 90s?
Maybe a little but I'd say still not safe for a kid. But I guess no one can compete with an 8 year old and some booby traps lol
Apparently they called it a "sadistic festival of adult-bashing"
How clever and insightful
I agree. It's a primal thing to enjoy seeing "bad guys" get beaten up in clever ways
Harry and Marv sure get shown who is boss of the house. It's nice they get brought to justice.
Agreed. It's a remarkably satisfying movie
Its also nice that the neighbor reunites with his son and family. A great holiday movie.
I think it was his daughter, but yeah. very feel good movie
It says in this key scenes it was his son, but i honestly don't remember. that part of the movie wasn't the highlight for me
True
Its surprising that his family made it back for Christmas day. Not really that realistic, but what movies are?
It needed to be that way so that the movie ended on the best note possible I suppose
Do you like comedy movies that best or another genre?
Drama or Psychological Horror are probably my favorites, but I really do love comedy
That was the last paragraph I think.....Are we done??
I think so!

uid1response.feedback: This took way longer than it should have because the other user took a very long time to respond to me.
